title: 111_s284
content: The Act titled "Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009" provides a refundable investment credit for property used in manufacturing solar energy products. The Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009 offers a refundable investment credit for property used in manufacturing solar energy products. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include expanding the definition of energy property and introducing special rules for the solar energy investment credit. The Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009 provides a refundable investment credit for solar energy products. Special rules apply to the solar energy investment credit, including adjustments to the minimum tax and limitations on the credit amount. The Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009 offers a refundable investment credit for solar energy products, with special rules and limitations. Excess investment credit is treated as a credit under subpart C, and the solar energy investment credit is defined as part of the energy credit. This provision does not apply after December 31, 2010. Conforming amendments are made to specified credits in the tax code. The Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009 provides a refundable investment credit for solar energy products. The amendments made by this section expand the specified credits to include the solar energy investment credit. These changes apply to taxable years starting after the enactment of the Act. The Solar Stimulus for Job Creation and Energy Independence Act of 2009 provides a refundable investment credit for solar energy products. Amendments exempt solar energy property from subsidized energy financing rules and private activity bond tests. Amendments exempt solar energy property from private business use and private loan financing tests under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this section apply to obligations issued after the enactment of this Act for the acquisition, construction, and installation of specified property. SEC. 5. GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT OF SOLAR ENERGY. Amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to allow contracts for renewable energy to be made for a period of up to 25 years.
